result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth C Lesniewski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).
  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).
  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).
  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).
  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution paid from cash bond posted.
Maintain employment as determined by probation agent.
Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. Not to write any checks.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Defendant can petition for early termination of probation after 2 years upon successful completion of all conditions of probation and with recommendation of probation agent.

To pay the costs of the action including court appointed attorney fees due DOOR COUNTY. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
4/21/16 - final court appointed atty bill added to JOC.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth C Lesniewski

defendant.name: Lesniewski, Kenneth C
defendant.address: 112 S. 3rd Avenue, Room 16, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

records.addlTxt: deceased 9-24-20

from defendant re: sentence credit.  Court responds:  Denied.  Sentence credits on each of these cases are correct.  Just because concurrent sentences were imposed at the same time doesn't serve to transform custody from one case to another. Each file involved a different course of criminal conduct on a different date. You have receive the appropriate credit in each file.  DTE

ADDRESS INFO for Kenneth C Lesniewski
Current: 112 S. 3rd Avenue, Room 16, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235 United States  (Effective: 01-10-2019)
Prior: 79 W Oak St  Apt 2, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

01:30 PM Defendant Kenneth C Lesniewski in court with attorney Sandra Jean Wagner.  Defendant Kenneth C Lesniewski in custody.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed.  State gives sentencing recommendation, makes statement.   Defense gives sentencing argument, requests time served sentence. Defendant makes statement. Court makes statement, imposes sentence.
1/5/19 letter to Judge and SPD Order Appointing Counsel
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 9, 2019 at 01:30 pm.
from Atty Wagner requesting to be able to coordinate the scheduling after revocation of probation hearing with the court calendar when revocation paperwork is received.    OK.  DTE

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Final court apptd atty bill from Steve Johnson. Court approves bill.
to Jandu Petroleum. Check forwarded to DA's office. Check #10219.
fingerprint card destroyed
Restitution summary
for DNA Sample

Defendant Kenneth C Lesniewski in court with attorney Stephen Pleck Johnson.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Minute sheet. Court reviews events in file. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1, 2, 3, 4 & 5. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1 - 5. Court dismisses Cts. 6 - 11 but reads in for sentencing. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
Defense Discovery Demand

Defendant Kenneth C Lesniewski not in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Johnson advised he just talked to defendant and defendant indicated he's ill will a stomach virus.  Court concerned that defendant has a poor track record of showing up for court. Court reschedules matter. If defendant doesn't appear in person for next hearing, court may be issuing a warrant for his arrest.  Status conference scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
2015 court appointed atty bill from Steve Johnson. Court approves bill.

Defendant Kenneth C Lesniewski appears by phone with attorney Stephen Pleck Johnson.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Johnson waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Atty Johnson would like time to talk to defendant about the State's offer and view discovery before proceeding. Court reminds defendant of court appointed atty payment due by 1/15/16. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
State's Discovery Demand
Contract for Repayment of Court-appointed Attorney Fees

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kenneth C Lesniewski in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defendant files petition for appoint of counsel form for courts review. Court appoints Atty Steve Johnson to represent defendant. Defendant to pay $100 per month toward atty fees. First payment due by 1/15/16. Bond remains in effect.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 10:00 am.
by defendant.
Not to use a checking account.
converted back to cash bond.
$150 cash bond must be posted by noon on 12/09/15. Not to use a checking account.
to signature bond until noon on 12/09/15.

Defendant Kenneth C Lesniewski appears by video conference.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court was advised by jail staff that defendant has funds in the bank to pay his case bond but his bank card won't work. Defendant would have to go to the bank to get the money to post bond. Court amended bond to a $500 signature bond. Bond will convert back to a $150 cash bond on Wednesday, 12/09/15 at noon.  $150 cash needs to be posted by then or defendant needs to report back to the jail. Same conditions apply. Court advises defendant to fill out petition for appt. of counsel form and file it when paying his bond.
Not to use a checking account.
Defendant in custody.

Defendant Kenneth C Lesniewski appears by video conference.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, questions defendant on missed court appearance. Defendant indicates he overslept. State requests an additional $250 cash bond. Defendant indicates he has no money to post bond. Court sets addtionial $150 cash bond, same conditions apply. Court will send another petition for appt. of counsel form to the for defendant to fill out.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Kenneth C Lesniewski not in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case at 10:41 am, reviews events in file. State requests bench warrant. Court orders bench warrant.

Defendant Kenneth C Lesniewski in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defendant indicates he can't afford to hire an attorney on his own. Court explains options to defendant. Defendant would to fill out form for court appointed atty. Defendant to fill out form and get it back to the court before his next court appearance. Bond remains in effect.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 10:00 am.
To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center. Not to use a checking account.

Defendant Kenneth C Lesniewski in court, in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant indicates he does not qualify for PD representation. Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel.  Defendant requests time to retain an atty. Court questions defendant on missed court appearance. Defendant indicates he had some medical issues yesterday, was arrested at the hospital. State requests cash bond w/conditions. Bond set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant in custody.

Defendant Kenneth C Lesniewski not in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews certificate of service showing defendant was served with todays court date. State requests bench warrant. Court orders bench warrant.
